description: Manage backend addresses of the cross-region load balance backend address pool.

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address add
commands.summary: Add one backend address into the load balance backend address pool.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address add --ip-address
                                       --lb-name
                                       --name
                                       --pool-name
                                       --resource-group
                                       [--admin-state {Down, None, Up}]
                                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                       [--subnet]
                                       [--virtual-network]
examples: az network lb address-pool address add -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool -n MyAddress --vnet MyVnet --ip-address 10.0.0.1

az network lb address-pool address add -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool -n MyAddress --subnet /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/MyRg/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet/subnets/subnet1 --ip-address 10.0.0.1

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address list
commands.summary: List all backend addresses of the load balance backend address pool.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address list --lb-name
                                        --pool-name
                                        --resource-group
examples: az network lb address-pool address list -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address remove
commands.summary: Remove one backend address from the load balance backend address pool.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address remove --lb-name
                                          --name
                                          --pool-name
                                          --resource-group
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network lb address-pool address remove -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool -n MyAddress

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address show
commands.summary: Show the backend address from the load balance backend address pool.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address show --lb-name
                                        --name
                                        --pool-name
                                        --resource-group
examples: az network lb address-pool address show -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool -n MyAddress

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address update
commands.summary: Update the backend address into the load balance backend address pool.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address update --lb-name
                                          --name
                                          --pool-name
                                          --resource-group
                                          [--add]
                                          [--admin-state {Down, None, Up}]
                                          [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--ip-address]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--remove]
                                          [--set]
                                          [--subnet]
                                          [--virtual-network]
examples: az network lb address-pool address update -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb --pool-name MyAddressPool -n MyAddress --subnet /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/MyRg/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet/subnets/subnet2

commands.name: az network lb address-pool address wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
commands.syntax:
az network lb address-pool address wait [--created]
                                        [--custom]
                                        [--deleted]
                                        [--exists]
                                        [--ids]
                                        [--interval]
                                        [--lb-name]
                                        [--pool-name]
                                        [--resource-group]
                                        [--subscription]
                                        [--timeout]
                                        [--updated]
